title: Seales fined for breaching ICC Code of Conduct
byline: Fast bowler Jayden Seales of the West Indies has been fined 15 per cent of his match fee for breaching Level 1 of the ICC Code of Conduct during the opening day of the first match of their ICC World Test Championship series against Australia in Bridgetown on Wednesday.

title: Sri Lanka’s tea for oil barter trade with Iran to take a hit due to crisis
byline: Sri Lanka’s barter trade with Iran (tea for oil) to settle dues for a previous transaction is likely to be hit by tension in the Middle-East at the moment, a Minister said.

title: Customs defends halt on cross-border LC vehicle imports, cites widespread duty fraud
byline: Sri Lanka Customs yesterday defended its recent decision to halt the clearance of vehicles imported under cross-border Letters of Credit (LCs), citing the measure as a crucial step to combat significant tax evasion through fraudulent under-valuation.

title: Sri Lanka to tour Zimbabwe for white-ball series
byline: Zimbabwe Cricket has confirmed that Sri Lanka will tour the country to contest in ODIs and T20Is.

title: University student missing at Colombo Port City artificial sea
byline: The Colombo Harbour Police have launched an investigation after a 24-year-old university student went missing while bathing in the artificial sea at the Colombo Port City on Thursday.

title: Over 300,000 narcotic pills seized in Kalpitiya
byline: Four parcels containing 317,000 narcotic pills were taken into police custody at Mohoththuwaram, a beach in Kalpitiya last night, Police said.

title: Hospitals ask patients to purchase artificial knee transplant tools privately: Dr. Chamal Sanjeewa
byline: It has now become common in many government hospitals for patients to be asked to buy important medical items like artificial knee transplant equipment and other surgical tools from private companies, as hospitals often do not have them in stock.

title: UN research ship chooses Madagascar instead of Sri Lanka, approval too late, so sad
byline: Despite the green light, the UN’s Food and Agriculture Organization (FAO) research vessel “Dr Fridtjof Nansen” is unlikely to visit Sri Lanka since approval came late, making timely scheduling for the survey here impossible, Daily Mirror learns.

title: Sri Lanka must target over 8% growth through innovation overhaul: Top economist
byline: Sri Lanka must shift its focus towards fostering innovation, empowering entrepreneurs, and moving beyond its current economic trajectory to achieve a prosperous future with a sustained growth rate of over 8

title: Badulla-Colombo train service disrupted after trees fall on track
byline: The Badulla-Colombo train service was disrupted this morning (June 27) after several large pine trees fell onto the railway track between Demodara and Ella railway stations along the Upcountry Railway Line, the Railway Department said.

title: Govt. to import 40,000 MTs of substitute rice
byline: The Food Policy and Security Committee has recommended the import of 40,000 metric tonnes of substitute rice for Keeri Samba.

title: Namal urges Govt to protect SMEs ahead of Parate Law deadline
byline: Parliamentarian Namal Rajapaksa has called on the government to take immediate action to safeguard small and medium enterprises (SMEs) as the implementation of the Parate Law for loan recoveries is set to take effect from July 1.

title: Two NPP members of Weligama Pradeshiya Sabha abducted: Party says
byline: Two National People’s Power (NPP) members of the Weligama Pradeshiya Sabha, who were on their way for the council meeting to elect the Chairman, have been abducted, the Janatha Vimukthi Peramuna (JVP) media unit said.

title: Student missing off Port City artificial beach
byline: The Colombo Harbour Police have launched an investigation after a 24-year-old university student went missing while bathing in the sea near the artificial beach at Port City Colombo on Thursday.

title: Indian fishermen nabbed Sri Lanka because their rights given up during Emergency: EAM Jaishankar
byline: The issue of Sri Lanka arresting Indian fishermen stems from an agreement during Emergency under which their rights for fishing in some specific areas were given up, External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar said on Friday.

title: 2,500 illegal constructions along Sri Lanka’s coastline
byline: The Department of Coastal Conservation and Coastal Resources Management has identified approximately 2,500 unauthorised constructions along Sri Lanka’s coastal belt.

title: Former CFHC Chairman granted bail
byline: Former Chairman of the Ceylon Fisheries Harbour Corporation (CFHC) in 2012, Upali Liyanage, was released on bail today after being arrested by the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption.

title: Bus crashes in Kantale after driver suffers heart attack
byline: A private bus crashed in Kantale town after the driver reportedly suffered a sudden heart attack, causing the vehicle to veer off the road and collide with an electricity pole, a roadside shop and two parked motorcycles.

title: Japan executes ’Twitter Killer’ who murdered nine people in 2017
byline: Japan executed a 34-year-old death row inmate known as the ’’Twitter Killer,’’ who was convicted of killing nine people at his apartment south of Tokyo in 2017, marking the first person to be put to death in the country in nearly three years.

title: Former CFHC Chairman Upali Liyanage arrested
byline: Former Chairman of the Ceylon Fisheries Harbour Corporation (CFHC) Upali Liyanage has been arrested by the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC).

title: Former SriLankan Airlines Chairman Nishantha Wickramasinghe arrested
byline: Former SriLankan Airlines Chairman Nishantha Wickramasinghe has been arrested by the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC) in connection with an ongoing investigation into aircraft procurement during his tenure.

title: Supreme Court suspends recent gazette on Northern Province land
byline: The Supreme Court today issued an interim order suspending the operation of the Gazette notification issued in respect of 5,941 acres of lands in the Northern Province.

title: Man sentenced to 60 years for abusing brother’s preschool daughter
byline: The Colombo High Court Judge, R.S.S Sapuwidana sentenced a 68 year old man to 60 years of rigorous imprisonment after finding him guilty of sexually abusing his own brother’s preschool daughter over a period of more than two months.

title: Ranil denies media reports on his UK visit
byline: The office of former President Ranil Wickremesinghe  denied media reports pertaining to his visit to the University of Wolverhampton in the United Kingdom on September 8, 2023.

title: Applications called for appointment of members to Office for Reparations
byline: Applications have been called from qualified individuals to fill the existing vacancy and the forthcoming vacancies for the post of member of the Office for Reparations.

title: Customs thwarts Indian smuggling Rs. 21.3 Mn worth Kush at BIA
byline: An Indian national trying to enter the country with Kush worth over Rs.21.3 million was intercepted by Sri Lanka Customs at the Bandaranaike International Airport last night.

title: Sri Lanka announces squad for Bangladesh ODI series
byline: The Sri Lanka Cricket Selection Committee has announced a 16-member squad for the upcoming three-match One Day International (ODI) series against Bangladesh, scheduled for July 2, 5, and 8, 2025.
